name: NH Maastricht

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is nice, clean and comfortable. But there some things that can be done to become a better hotel. The room is comfortable, but there is no mini bar. this hotel is not a 4 stars, but 3 stars or 2 superior. Another bad thing that this hotel should provide to the guest is a free parking, it is not near of city center and a lot of guests go there by car, so a free parking will be good. All the car parkings in Netherlands are very expensive.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...
Simple hotel with very high price
reviews.text: At overall, this hotel is nice, friendly staff and good property. So I recommend.

Rooms of this hotel are 2 or max 3 star. Very simple bath room no mini bar and no nice view. Positive aspect is that the hotel is clean and breakfast is ok. This kind of business hotel without any character you find everywhere in the world. Price > 160 eur for a room is not in sync with the quality delivered
reviews.title: Business trip to Maastricht

reviews.text: I was staying in this hotel when attending conference in nearby MECC (Congress center). The short distance was a big plus, but the hotel itself was plain en not very special. Rooms were tidy and clean but very basic.
reviews.title: Nice place for business

reviews.text: I stayed there for 4 nights during a conference at the MCC around the corner. The rooms are clean and quiet, the breakfirst is remarcable and it is only 15 minutes walk to downtown Maastricht.
reviews.title: Average proper business hotel

reviews.text: walk able distance from Randwijk rail station, the hotel is in the city's newer development area a short journey from the city center. The staff was very helpful & the rooms neat.The bed really comfortable. I am a fan of NH hotels having stayed in one of their Vienna properties, earlier. The breakfast was really an awesome spread.Check out was swift.
reviews.title: A bit away but very comfortable hotel

reviews.text: I would stay in a NH hotel any where.
reviews.title: Nice beds!

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night visiting Maastricht with friends. The room was lovely, all very modern and clean and with a lovely comfy bed! Staff were very friendly and helpful, and looked after our luggage while we were visiting the city on the last day. You even get a free late check-out at 5pm on Sundays.
reviews.title: Good location and good stay

reviews.text: Very good value for money as we had an online offer, but I think their normal prices would be pretty standard value for money too.
reviews.title: Perfectly adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes it is a 4* hotel and I guess that this rating is justified …. but… you can get a certification with “pass” mark OR with “excellent” score. In this case NH Maastricht just gets the pass mark.
reviews.title: A hotel that tries to get the maximum while giving the minimum.

reviews.text: Is there a spacious “double” room? Yes, in terms of square meters but it is not a Queen/King size bed… only two single mattresses adjacent together, with so wear-out mattress you can feel the springs.
reviews.title: Standard conference hotel

reviews.text: Is there a TV? Yes, but it is an old-type CRT TV and although in some cases it could be better than early generation TFTs, the reception is bad and the viewing experience terrible.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: Is there a bathtub? Yes, in 4* hotels it is not "shower-only" … but yet again … it is not a full-size bath tub.
reviews.title: Average place

reviews.text: Do they have different pillows available? Yes, but it is not in your room. You have to call and ask explicitly and then they offer a great selection of four different types (e.g. neck support, soft, firm, organic) which is great.
reviews.title: Standard Business Hotel

reviews.text: We found a nice deal online for 3 nights for the price of 2 and decided to get away for a few days to experience maastricht. Although the hotel was not very expensive, it rates itself as a 4 star hotel and is clearly a 3 star. The rooms looked like they haven't been redecorated since the 1970's and the maid service didn't even bother to take away our used glasses in the morning. The sauna was overpriced and the steam bath smelled like a male locker room. Also, the restaurant was pretty expensive and not great. However, the staff was friendly and the breakfast buffet was delicious. We still had a lovely time and it wasn't all bad, but I would not pay full price for this hotel. Also,it is very far from the center of Maastricht, which was ok for us, but might be disappointing for others.
reviews.title: Underwhelming

reviews.text: Great hotel for stay in Maastricht. Morning complimentary breakfast was one of the best I have ever had and just from that I would stay there again. Very nice accommodations. Only thing is it is located about 10 mins from the downtown area. So that means to walk it is 25 mins or by taxi it is 10 Euro. Would reccommend for next time, nice stay
reviews.title: Great Hotel Stay

reviews.text: I have only been here 6 hours but I think I have the measure of the place. The staff are so friendly and helpful that I don't like to say anything negative but it must be done so here goes. Can you imagine Fawlty Towers without the rudeness? The point is they fall over backwards to put things right immediately but so much has gone wrong in a few short hours. Faulty heating, someones underwear found in otherwise spotless room, Meal completely different from description on menu, They want full payment in advance because I am using a debit card. Why? It is also a long way from the centre and no restaurants nearby. Sorry to excellent staff.
reviews.title: Convenient for the hospital and the convention centre otherwise stay elsewhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was just great, the bed, the room, the bathroom, and yes - very nice breakfast :)
reviews.title: Such a nice hotel

reviews.text: But not very friendly stuff at the front desk!!!
reviews.title: an NH Hotel

description: Mid-rise Hotel with fitness center, sauna, jacuzzi, restaurant and bar; connected to the Congress Center, near the train station.
